title: Accelerate Machine Learning with IntelÂ® Software Tools | Intel Software

json.text:
Data is one of the world's
most important currencies.

If you're a data scientist
or software developer,

you face a deluge of
data from many sources.

And more and more,
you'll need to analyze

this data in near real
time to leverage machine

learning, a form of
artificial intelligence.

Make your code work
harder and move

from data to actionable results
and insights faster with Intel

Data analytics
Acceleration Library,

or Intel DAAL for short, and
Intel distribution for Python.

These tools are,
highly optimized

for Intel architecture, make it
easy to achieve high performing

machine learning and
data analytics code.

Intel DAAL includes fast off
the shelf algorithms for many

tasks, and you have your choice
of language APIs, Python,
C++ or Java.

Intel DAAL also
processes large datasets
that won't fit into memory.

Data congestion and computation
can execute in parallel

to maximize throughput and
deliver results sooner.

Intel DAAL can also
distribute computations

across multiple
machines on a network

so larger problems can
be tackled compared
to a single compute node.

The power and
performance of Intel DAAL

are also part of the Intel
distribution for Python,

which delivers super fast
accelerated Python application

performance right
out of the box.

Intel distribution for Python
is built from open source Python

so any existing code
runs without changes.
It just runs faster.

To achieve near native code
performance, widely used

packages NumPy, SciPy,
and scikit-learn

are accelerated under the hood
with the highly tuned Intel

DAAL and Intel Mac
Kernel Library.

These libraries are written
in C and assembly language.

They're threaded and
vectorized to take

full advantage of all
Intel processor families,

often delivering between
one to two orders

of magnitude improvement over
interpreted open source Python.

And Intel DAAL and Intel
distribution for Python
are both entirely free.

Deliver screaming
fast machine learning.

Start using Intel DAAL and
Intel Python distribution today.
